archimate:BusinessProcess.name: LSA process
archimate:BusinessProcess.documentation:
LSA gathers all technical data required to produce & deliver the Support manuals (AMM, IPC, Training, etc.). Part of the LSA activities consists in influencing the design in order to optimize the maintenance of the machine. In case of issue for maintainability for instance, LSA shall require the design to be changed. Note: -MSG 3 is the “what” and the “when” -Maintenance manuals are the “how” --- MSG3 also enables intelligent troubleshooting and other various stuff --- LSA aims at describing the supportability concept for the ILS in the downstream process: - Operational / Intermediate Maintenance Level (OLM/ILM) Operations for final customers on how to operate the H/C; - Identify all the parts from Design office that can be procurable to the customers (procurable / spare parts).
These data are deliverables respectively for ILS that aims at delivering the Maintenance Tech Data (MTD) and for Part Tech Data (PTD) to produce IPC.
The sources of data are Design Office delivered through: - DMU (from CATIA/VPM) ; - 2D Drawings from CorePDM (Windchill) ; - Documents (pdf, word): technical notes, descriptive documents, FMECA and all maintainability studies (note that the design office performs the maintainability study – Reliability Availability Maintainability & Testability).
